solution_line_template: First figure out how many miles over the speed limit Mark was going: {mark_speed} mph - {speed_limit} mph = <<{mark_speed}-{speed_limit}={mph_over}>>{mph_over} mph
Now figure out how much the per-mile fine is: ${per_mile_fine}/mph * {mph_over} mph = $<<{per_mile_fine}*{mph_over}={per_mile_total}>>{per_mile_total}
Now add that amount to the base fine: ${per_mile_total} + ${base_fine} = $<<{per_mile_total}+{base_fine}={fine_plus_base}>>{fine_plus_base}
Now double that amount for being in a school zone: ${fine_plus_base} * {school_zone_multiplier} = $<<{fine_plus_base}*{school_zone_multiplier}={school_zone_fine}>>{school_zone_fine}
Now figure out how much Mark owes his lawyer: ${lawyer_hourly}/hour * {lawyer_hours} hours = $<<{lawyer_hourly}*{lawyer_hours}={lawyer_fees}>>{lawyer_fees}
Now add the court costs, lawyer fees and fine: ${lawyer_fees} + ${court_costs} + ${school_zone_fine} = $<<{lawyer_fees}+{court_costs}+{school_zone_fine}={total_owed}>>{total_owed}
